adjectives.description: turnkey (comparative more turnkey, superlative most turnkey)

entries.meaning: Ready to use without further assembly or test; supplied in a state that is ready to turn on and operate (typically refers to an assembly that is outsourced for manufacture)
examples: They wanted a turnkey solution for the entire system, but we could only provide the enclosure.

entries.meaning: (now archaic) A warder or jailer/gaoler; keeper of the keys in a prison.

verbs.description: turnkey (third-person singular simple present turnkeys, present participle turnkeying, simple past and past participle turnkeyed)

entries.meaning: To supply a turnkey product; to supply something fully assembled and ready to use.
examples: We can sell you all the parts, or we can turnkey the entire unit.
